channel.title: [639] Dementhium - Clicking object to teleport help
channel.description:
I'm trying to make it where in the mithril dragon caves - if you click go up/down stairs it'll actually take you to the 1st/2nd floor of the cave. However I am having some issues with coding it. I went into objectpackethandler.java and made this case:
Code:
[code] case 25339: player.teleport(1778, 5343, 1); break;[/code]
compiled, restarted server. However when I try and go up the staircase I get a "incoming object opcode" error ingame; and in the server cmd prompt I get this error: "[ObjectPacketHandler] 25340, 10, 0, [1778,5344,1 lx 50 ly 48 ] Clip: 1073742080"
Any ideas on how I can solve this issue? All help is appreciated!

item.title: [639] Dementhium - Clicking object to teleport help
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

No it doesn’t - I thought of the circumstance myself before. The code to the lower stairwell is 25339. The code for the upper stairwell is 25340. And just to make sure it wasn’t arranged strangely I switched the coords to test the theory - the code for some odd reason just doesn’t work; and I’m unsure of what I need to do to the case to fix it

Read full topic
item.source: [639] Dementhium - Clicking object to teleport help

item.title: [639] Dementhium - Clicking object to teleport help
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

99rangek0:

Didn’t affect it at all

Is it because your function in that case teleports you to exactly the same spot you are at?

Read full topic
